original: ERICSON, Johan Teodor, Grosshandlare, Stockholm, f St Kil, Värml, 5/6 82, gm Ellen "Lindqvist. Hdlssk Sthlm 02, stud i Tyskl, Engl Frankr 02—04. Anst i byggn.branschen i Sthlm 09—12, start eg trav- o byggn.mtrlrör i ’Sthlm, Fma Teodor Ericson, 12; ombud i Sthlm f AB Åtvidabergs Ind f parkettgolv f ed. 23; ensam försälj i Sv f Schröders Kork-solerings AB Ulvsunda sed. 30 samt styr.led denna fma. Styr.led i AB Ska Bkns Sthlms-sont 36. Av stdsflm vald rev f drätselnmd, stadskoll, gatunmd, hdls- o sjöf.nmd, inskriv-i.rev mfl, led av tax.nmd. Odd Fellow. RNO.
translated: ERICSON, Johan Teodor, merchant, Stockholm, born in St Kil, Värmland, on June 5th, 1882, married to Ellen "Lindqvist. Attended trade school in Stockholm in 1902, studied in Germany, England, and France from 1902-1904. Employed in the construction industry in Stockholm from 1909-1912, started own business in carriage and building materials in Stockholm, named Teodor Ericson, in 1912; representative in Stockholm for AB Åtvidabergs Industries selling parquet flooring from 1923; sole salesperson in Sweden for Schröders Cork Insulation AB in Ulvsunda since 1930, and served on the board of directors. Board member of AB Ska Bkns Stockholm Branch in 1936. Elected member of various municipal committees, such as finance committee, city checks committee, street committee, trade and shipping committee, and others, as well as a member of the tax committee. Member of the Odd Fellow fraternity. Awarded with the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO).

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star (RNO)

career.occupational_title: Founder and owner of carriage and building materials business
Sole salesperson for Schröders Cork Insulation AB
Board member of AB Ska Bkns Stockholm Branch
